title: "Hands Off" Continues.......

description:
This is a local Indivisible event! 

Donald Trump and Elon Musk think this country belongs to them. We are fighting back!

They're taking everything they can get their hands on—our health care, our data, our jobs, our services—and daring the world to stop them. This is a crisis, and the time to act is now.

🚨 On Saturday, April 26th, we're taking to the streets to fight back with a clear message: Hands off! 🚨

This is our message to the world that we do not consent to the destruction of our government and our economy for the benefit of Trump and his billionaire allies. We are protesting to demand a stop the chaos and build an opposition movement against the looting of our country.

A core principle behind all Hands Off! events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.

Volunteers work with farmers and vendors to collect perishables they want to donate. These items are then delivered to our community partners at Southeast Community Services Food Pantry. 

Interested in gleaning a farmers market?  Reach out to Audra today at in-glean@endhunger.org or at 317-607-0004

title: MountainTrue Riverkeeper Beer Series Clean-up in Asheville, NC with Hi-Wire Brewing 8/23
description:
Our region’s rivers were heavily impacted by Hurricane Helene, and with breweries playing a key role in our tourism economy, MountainTrue, the French Broad Riverkeeper, and Hi-Wire Brewing are teaming up to help restore our waterways.

Join us on August 23rd for a river cleanup! We'll head out for an on-the-water cleanup, then return to the brewery to celebrate with beer and prizes.

We encourage you to bring your own boat to clean-up. If you need to borrow a boat, MountainTrue has boat spots for 20 people. Please make sure you bring a PFD if you bring your own boat.

***If you need to borrow a boat, please copy and paste this URL to reserve your boat spot: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc4qIpMw6QKKD5LpDOjnRg3Y6JkNkFTnZaEWmN-nYOAl0lfbA/viewform?usp=sharing

All participants, regardless of whether borrowing a boat or bringing their own, MUST pre-register for the clean-up so we can adhere to safety standards.

All volunteers are eligible to receive a complimentary annual membership to MountainTrue. Please email members@mountaintrue.org to request yours!

Kids under the age of 18 are welcome as long as accompanied by a parent or guardian AND they feel comfortable in a boat for several hours.

A HUGE thank you to Hi-Wire Brewing, Eno and Recover brands for sponsoring this event!

title: NVM 2025 May Volunteer Meeting: Primary Kickoff
description:
Join us on Zoom for our May Volunteer Meeting! We will be kicking off our field work ahead of the June Democratic Primary. Come hear about New Virginia Majority's mission, Primary endorsements, strategy, and event rollout.

A Zoom link will be sent out the day before the meeting.



Community Rules of Conduct and Engagement:

By signing up for this event, we assume that you will fully abide by our Community Standards and Rules of Engagement. If a volunteer is in violation of any one of these standards, they will be removed and barred from future events at our discretion. We do this in order to protect our staff and volunteers as well as create a safe and welcoming environment.

I will respect NVM staff who have organized this meeting as well as my fellow volunteers by being conscious of our time restraints, avoiding using harsh/foul language, and giving everyone a chance to speak. We will assume good intent of all participants and staff.

NVM organizes around and centers the needs of working class communities of color. Please keep in mind that the strategies & messaging we use have been developed to keep those communities at the center of our work. Therefore, the strategies & messaging we use may not match up with your specific expectations and may be different from what you've experienced working with other volunteer organizations. Please keep this in mind as we work together to build a more equitable Virginia that is home to all.

I recognize the reality that there could be changes regarding the scheduling of this event and its agenda. We will do our best to give you advanced notice if and when changes are made.

I will NOT share the zoom information or any internal documentation with anyone else. We ask this for our own security.

title: BYOP Texting Boot Camp: Register Democrats!
description:
We love free texting! That's why we're partnering with Field Team 6 to bring their free texting program to Orange County. They call it BYOP or Bring Your Own Phone, although it actually uses your own computer, usually with an anonymized Google Voice number. It's a great way to register new Democrats!

There are a few things you'll need to set up on your computer but they aren't difficult, and we provide all the training you need at the BYOP Boot Camp sessions.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RQeU1Z9YVpnqI0dLFD7CV2HBEgP--R2-OfGITkfd34g/edit?usp=sharing

Once trained, you'll be able to send texts any time between 9 am – 9 pm in the Time Zone you're texting. We have multiple campaigns available (listed in the document linked above) and you get to choose which one appeals to you.

ABOUT FIELD TEAM 6: Field Team 6 is a volunteer army on a simple mission: Register Democrats. Save the World. To win in 2020, we helped register 785,000 Democratic voters in 11 key swing states. In 2022, we brought that total to 2.3 million and defied history, preventing a Red Wave and increasing our Senate majority. We did this by registering women, young people, people of color, the LGBTQ+ community, and every single good-hearted person we could find... and getting them out to vote! Now it’s time to save the world again – so we’re registering new Democrats who can paint the House Blue in '26 and win a Blue Trifecta in '28 to save democracy!

title: Postcarding & Conversation with Ben Max of Max Politics Podcast
description:
We strive to build community, educate voters, and use our Sharpies to write to save democracy together. Join us to write postcards, talk about the news, and hear from candidates and political leaders. 

Please answer the registration questions accurately and completely. If this is your first time joining this group, please sign on at least 15 minutes before the speaker start time listed below. Compliance with these requests will facilitate admission to our Zoom meeting.

**Ben Max of Max Politics Podcast will join us at 10:00am on Friday, May 9.** Ben Max is the Executive Editor and Program Director of the Center for New York City and State Law at New York Law School (NYLS) and Host of the Max Politics podcast where he interviews leading figures in New York politics and policy, including several of the candidates running in the NYC municipal elections. Previously, Ben spent ten years as the Executive Editor of Gotham Gazette, a nonprofit news publication focused on NYC and NYS government, policy, and politics. Before he started covering New York politics, Ben worked in K-12 education, mostly as a high school history teacher. He grew up in Queens and lives in Brooklyn. Come prepared with your questions about New York politics, including the current citywide races.

Write postcards with us or just join the conversation. If you need help getting started with postcarding, please visit our [FAQ](https://markersfordemocracy.org/postcarding/postcarding-faq).

If you are with the media and want to attend, you must notify us at markersfordemocracy@gmail.com at least two hours before the start of the event. All discussions are off the record.

This event is co-hosted by [Markers For Democracy](https://markersfordemocracy.org), [Downtown Nasty Women Social Group](https://linktr.ee/DNWSG), and [Team Min](https://linktr.ee/teammin
).

title: Know Means Know: Building Power Through Connection
description:
Have you ever thought, “I know my friends and family care — I just wish they’d get involved”? You’re not alone. Come to this month’s Know Means Know webinar and we will show you how to use a technique called relational organizing to turn the connections you already have with people you know into meaningful action for sex education at the school board level. You’ll help your friends reach out to their own school board members and engage them to do the same with their own circles. That’s how real momentum starts — with a small group of people who work together to make a difference. 
In just one hour you’ll:

* Hear from people who’ve used relational organizing to build real change in their community.

* Try it out with real-time support from experts

* Learn how to develop and run your own low-cost relational organizing campaign 

* Have a chance to win a $25 gift card just for taking action

Want to know more? Meet our presenters:

Louise Walpin is a retired Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nurse. She is the Director of Advocacy and Organizing for SWEEP NJ, a statewide grassroots advocacy group with over 3000 members.  Louise worked closely with the bill sponsors to pass the Freedom to Read Act and is currently focused on bills to protect transgender healthcare and the immigrant community. 
 Louise, and her wife of 36 years, were the lead couple in the 2009-2013 legislative fight for marriage equality, as well as one of the lead plaintiff couples in the Lambda Legal lawsuit that secured marriage for same sex couples in NJ.  Louise’s activism has earned her annual recognition on the Insider NJ LGBTQ Power List, as well as Assemblywoman Sumter’s Women Power List.  When not engaged in activism, you can usually find Louise with her grandchildren, horse or dog.


James Herrmann is the Campaigns Director at Empower Project. He began his career during the 2016 election cycle in New York and Ohio and has since worked across the country for progressive causes and campaigns. James specializes in relational organizing, fundraising, and campaign management, and he partners with campaigns, state democratic parties and organizations nationwide to build strong, people-powered programs.

title: MICHIGAN: Proof of Citizenship Voting & What It Could Mean For You
description:

Join us from 6PM ET - 7PM ET for a virtual webinar, and learn a new topic to learn about each month!

In May, Common Cause Michigan and our guest co-host from partner organization Promote the Vote will share with you insights on the various federal and state (Michigan) proposed changes to election law that would require proof of citizenship and could impact your ability to vote in future elections. 

We want you to have the facts, where things stand, and to know exactly what is at stake - and we will look forward to answering some of your questions as well!

title: Operation: Primary Postcard Power!
description:

If you cannot attend but wish to support this effort, please consider donating toward the purchase of postcard stamps. You can select your quantity and make a donation quickly via credit card at https://secure.actblue.com/donate/postcard-power.

If you'd prefer to pick up postcards and labels and prepare the mailing at home, just get in touch with Ellen at 540-222-3439 by text or call.

Join us in this simple yet powerful act of democracy. Let's show the power of community action, one postcard at a time. Together, we can ensure voters are informed and ready to cast their ballots.

Suite 101
Northfield, NJ 08225
Phone: (609) 625-5008

**Event Description:**  
Congressman Jeff Van Drew is supposed to represent **us**—but he only meets with **donors**, **special interests**, and **MAGA extremists**.

He hasn’t held a public town hall in years, and his voting record speaks for itself:
- **Voted against certifying the 2020 election results**
- Opposed **abortion rights**, **student loan forgiveness**, and **LGBTQ+ protections**
- Supports efforts to **defund public education** and deny the climate crisis
- Turns his back on working people and silences dissent in our district

So we show up. Peacefully. Persistently. Every other Tuesday.

> **Donors get the meetings. Constituents get ignored.**

We’re rallying outside his **Northfield District Office** to demand visibility, accountability, and representation. This is a **peaceful protest** to let our neighbors—and our congressman—know we are watching.

**What to Bring:**
- Signs (or use ours!)  
- Friends, neighbors, coworkers  
- Water, weather-appropriate clothing  
- Your voice and your presence  

**Accessibility:**  
- Public sidewalk with parking nearby  
- No marching—stand or sit as long as you’d like  
- Family-friendly and open to all

We’ve coordinated with local police to ensure a safe, orderly, nonviolent demonstration. Everyone who believes in democracy is welcome.

title: Grassroots Fundraising Training
description:
You Geared Up, you Protected & Resisted, you got on that dialer more times than you can count. Or maybe you haven’t yet been in the streets or on the phone banks, but you are ready to step into your power and build the movement!

Our work is to organize more white people than ever before into the movement for racial justice and towards communities that work for ALL of us. While this moment is dark, this movement’s future is bright, and to build all that’s possible, it needs to be funded. 

Come build your skills in preparation for the Spring Grassroots Fundraising Drive where a team of SURJ members from all over the country (including YOU?!), will spend 10 days collectively raising over $100,000! 

Sign up for ONE of these two training times!

Our movements are most powerful when they’re funded by the base (that’s you!). Grassroots fundraising has been part of every successful movement in U.S. history, and it is being criminalized (like Trump going after ActBlue) precisely because organizing money is so powerful. 

Fundraising in community gives us the capacity to organize more people, share the work of SURJ with new people and invite them into our work. We need your help to grow the base of people putting money on the line to challenge authoritarianism.

The Spring Fundraising Drive is a 10-day “sprint” from May 28-June 6. This fundraising drive is open for all SURJ members, new and experienced, from all class backgrounds. 

Attendance at ONE of these two trainings is the first step to participate. We’ll get skilled up and prepare for the array of good, and sometimes sticky, conversations you’ll have about money as a donor organizer. See you there!

——————————

*“Making my goal was a very rejuvenating experience. After the fundraising drive, I felt more grounded in my SURJ membership than ever, and it was a surprising joy to share about my work with SURJ while asking for support from my community.”* - Elma, Grassroots Fundraiser, Spring ‘24 

*“I expected to be more nervous about reaching out to people from a few decades ago, but coaches and others suggested that people might be happy that I thought of them for this campaign. And that turned out to be very true! People thanked me for asking them for money and for giving them something to put their anxiety into!”* - Margaret, Grassroots Fundraiser, Fall ‘24

title: Pennsylvania Alliance for Retired Americans Save Medicaid Phone Bank
description:
The US House of Representatives and Senate have passed a budget framework that would give a massive tax break to the wealthiest Americans by slashing Medicaid and SNAP. This budget blueprint would cut up to $880 billion from Medicaid in the next 10 years. If approved, this budget blueprint would be disastrous for Pennsylvania’s seniors and families.
Around 400,000 Pennsylvania seniors rely on Medicaid for essential health care, and Medicaid pays for the care of 5 out of every 8 nursing home residents in our state.

Join us in the fight to protect Medicaid, by signing up for our Save Medicaid online phone bank on Tuesday, May 13th, from 10:00 am -12:00 pm. Our phone bank will be calling seniors in Pennsylvania’s 7th and 8th Congressional Districts—in the Lehigh Valley and the Scranton area. Both these are swing districts represented by freshmen Republican congressmen who unseated Democratic incumbents last November. Many of Representative Mackenzie’s and Representative Bresnahan’s constituents rely on Medicaid for their healthcare. We will call seniors in those districts to encourage them to call their House Representatives to tell them they oppose cuts to Medicaid. 

Before making calls, PARA will provide all phone bank participants with a brief training on our phone banking system and a script to use when calling constituents. No phone banking experience is necessary to join us. Staff will be on hand to answer any questions and guide you through the process.

On Saturday, May 10, concerned citizens will gather in communities across Ohio to say no to the bullies and billionaires who are threatening our freedoms, stealing our children's future and disappearing neighbors from our streets. Join us and make your voice heard!

Also, come hear premier Cleveland musicians performing as **Musicians Against Dictators (MAD)**!

Come dressed in whatever makes you happy (maybe bright colors, rainbows, costumes). We are choosing to focus on JOY in these chaotic times!

There will be a **collection of hygiene products** for area families in need- so bring deodorant, soap, shampoo, toothpaste, diapers/wipes, etc. if you can!

**All ages welcome! Rain or shine!**

Hosted by Mobilize the Vote NEO, Cuyahoga Democratic Women's Caucus, GRR (Grass Roots Resistance); GRAB (Grass Roots Activism Bay), Indivisible NEO, Americans Making Immigrants Safe (AMIS)

description:
Join us to fight for a VA that puts veterans — not billionaires — first.

Under the Musk/Trump administration, veterans are being shortchanged. We’ve seen massive layoffs, funding cuts, and chaos at the Veterans Administration (VA). These failures directly threaten the care and dignity veterans deserve. Veterans deserve a VA that is fully resourced, fully
accountable, and fully committed to honoring their service.

Jay Carey of Resist/Persist will join us as our keynote speaker to expose how current policies are failing veterans and how we can fight back and organize for the VA that actually serves those who served.

If you care about veterans, the VA, or building a government that truly honors its commitments, join us for this urgent conversation about protecting veterans’ rights and shaping a better future.

Who should attend:  Anyone ready to stand up for veterans’ rights, resist harmful policies, and help shape a future where veterans, not billionaires, come first.

title: Join the National Day of Action for Single Payer Healthcare - Tillamook County
description:
## Tillamook for Universal Health Care
Saturday, May 31st | 1:30 PM – 4:30 PM |
Tillamook County Library (Hatfield Room)

### Join us in Tillamook for a local gathering as part of the National Day of Action for Single Payer Health Care. 
This is a chance to come together, connect with neighbors, and learn more about the growing movement to win universal, publicly funded health care in Oregon.

Our current health care system is **expensive**, **confusing**, and often **denies** people the care they need. But real change is _possible_—and it starts with everyday Oregonians getting informed and organized.

#### What to Expect:

- A welcoming space to meet others in Tillamook who care about health care justice
- Updates on what’s happening in Oregon’s campaign for single payer
- Information on how to support the work locally and statewide
- A casual, community-centered gathering
- Time for group discussion and reflection

Whether you’ve been organizing for years or are just starting to learn about the issue, this event is for _you_. It’s about building connection, learning together, and helping put Oregon on the path to a health care system that serves all of us—not just the wealthy few.

This is the Tillamook action in a nationwide day of events calling for health care as a human right. Come be part of the conversation—and the solution.

title: MAY DAY: WOODSTOCK WORKERS RISING
description:
📣 EVENT UPDATE – PLEASE READ

Due to the forecast of severe thunderstorms on Saturday, we are rescheduling the “May Day: Woodstock Workers Rising” protest to Saturday, May 10.
🕓 Same time
📍 Same location
🛟 Same safety protocols and logistics—unless otherwise noted
☀️ The weather for May 10 is expected to be clear and rain-free.

BUT—we’re still gathering this weekend.

Instead of protesting in the storm, we’re inviting everyone to join us indoors at the Artists’ Spring Art Showcase at the Artisan Resource Center in Marietta. It’s a huge, open, community-driven space filled with local art, open studios, and a handmade artisan market—just in time for Mother’s Day.

🎨 Saturday, May 3 — 10am to 6pm
📍 585 Cobb Pkwy SE, Marietta, GA 30060
🎟️ Free & open to the public
🔗 http://www.artisanresourcecenter.net/events.html

Why this matters:
Fascism always targets art. Creators challenge power, build culture, and make resistance visible. Showing up for artists is showing up for freedom. In an era of censorship, tariffs, and corporate monopolies, our local artists need solidarity—and you just might find better deals than at a big box store.

Thanks for staying grounded, flexible, and focused on what we’re building together.
See you this weekend—and next.

—Indivisible Woodstock CAN

🛠 DRESS THE PART. BRING A SIGN. STAND WITH WORKERS.

This May Day, we stand together as the people who keep this town running—workers who teach our kids, care for the sick, grow our food, build our homes, and serve our neighbors.

No matter your job or background, we all deserve a fair shot: fair pay, personal freedom, safe communities, and leaders who work for us, not just for billionaires and backroom lobbyists.

Too many of those freedoms are being chipped away—by people in power who treat workers like a cost to cut, not a voice to listen to.

We say no more.

👕 Dress up as a worker—your job, or one you admire.
🪧 Make a sign that shows what that worker deserves—and what’s at risk.

👨‍👩‍👧 This is a peaceful, family-friendly protest.
✊Wear red, white, and blue to show we are the real patriots.
🚫 No profanity on signs—our message is strong without it.

--------------

🛠 WHAT IS MAY DAY?

May Day—International Workers’ Day—honors the people who built this country.

It began with American workers striking in 1886 for the eight-hour workday. When police opened fire on protesters at Chicago’s Haymarket Square, it became a global symbol of the fight for dignity on the job.

Governments around the world now recognize May 1st as a day to stand with labor. But in the U.S., we’ve been told to forget.

We remember. May Day belongs to us. And we’re reclaiming it.

--------------

🧍🏽‍♀️ EXAMPLES: LOCAL WORKERS, LOCAL POWER

🛒 Retail Worker (Publix, Target, Home Depot) with a sign that says, “We stock your shelves. Don’t empty our paychecks.”

👩🏽‍⚕️ Healthcare Worker (Nurse, Tech, Aide) with a sign that says, “We care for your family. Let us care for ours.”

📚 Teacher or School Staff with a sign that says, “Let us teach. Keep politics out of the classroom.”

🍽 Restaurant or Food Service Worker with a sign that says, “We served through the storm. We deserve better.”

💼 Office Worker / Business Services with a sign that says, “We’re not overhead. We’re the engine.”

👷 Construction Worker with a sign that says, “We build Woodstock. Give us a future here.”

⚙️ Manufacturing or Warehouse Worker with a sign that says, “We move the goods. Respect the hands behind the supply chain.”

--------------

✊ WHAT TO EXPECT:

We’ll line up peacefully along the sidewalk in downtown Woodstock with signs and costumes

This is a legal, unpermitted protest: we will obey all laws and exercise our First Amendment rights without blocking traffic or pedestrians

--------------

🔧 HOW TO JOIN:

- Pick your worker costume

title: Tesla Takedown Protest in Seaside, Ca
description:
Join us EVERY Saturday at 12pm to protest Elon Musk and his unconstitutional dismantling of the federal government. Bring a sign, your friends, musical instruments, whatever makes you happy.

*** Please be aware that we'e seen some counter protestors at these events. They're mostly loud and obnoxious, trying to provoke a response. The best thing to do is ignore them entirely and not give them the attention they crave. ***

We have more people every week! It's a good time and we get a lot of positive feedback from passing cars. It might seem like a small thing but every little bit helps. And it feels good to DO SOMETHING so come on down!

Elon Musk and DOGE are engaged in an administrative coup of the federal government. They have taken control of the federal payment system and are unilaterally suspending funds appropriated by congress, in clear violation of the Constitution.

They have already caused immense harm by dismantling USAID and have set their sights on everything from the Social Security to the NIH and the FAA next. Make no mistake, their end goal is the destruction of the US Federal Government and its ability to check corporate power and provide basic services.

How this develops in Washington remains to be seen, but as US citizens we can exercise our 1st Amendment right to peacefully protest. Elon Musk's liquid net worth is largely based on Tesla stock, which is currently valued at 10-15 times that of other car companies. Driving down the share price is a direct attack on Elon's power.

The stakes couldn’t be higher. No one is coming to save us—not politicians, not the media. It's up to the people to stand up and fight for democracy and against fascism.

title: Collier County Democratic Club May (5/12/25) Meeting
description:
Diane Preston Moore, President of the League of Women's Voters of Collier County, will present “Over 100 Years of Empowering Voters: Why the League of Women Voters Still Matters”.  She will review the history of LWV and discuss the actions the League has taken in the more recent past, including legal action by the Florida and US Leagues.

Ms. Moore has been a member of the League of Women Voters of Collier County for over 10 years. She has been on the Board of LWVCC since 2020, served as Vice President of LWVCC from 2021-22, and as President of LWVCC from 2022-25.  She currently chairs both the Governance Committee and the Speakers Bureau.  In addition, Preston Moore served as a past Chairs of the Education Committee and of the Canvassing Board Subcommittee of Voter Services. 

Diane received her Bachelor of Science in 1987 and her J.D. in 1996, both from the College of William & Mary.  She practiced in the Washington, D.C. office of Whiteford, Taylor & Preston for 5 years. Diane relocated to Naples to be closer to her husband's family, and practiced law with Bond, Schoeneck & King, then with Fowler White before “retiring” to work part-time in the family’s hospitality businesses, the Vanderbilt Beach Resort and Turtle Club Restaurant.

REFRESHMENTS WILL BE AVAILABLE.

title: Postcarding & Conversation with Sam Mellins and Rebecca Klein of New York Focus
description:
We strive to build community, educate voters, and use our Sharpies to write to save democracy together. Join us to write postcards, talk about the news, and hear from candidates and political leaders. 

Please answer the registration questions accurately and completely. If this is your first time joining this group, please sign on at least 15 minutes before the speaker start time listed below. Compliance with these requests will facilitate admission to our Zoom meeting.

**Sam Mellins and Rebecca Klein of New York Focus will join us at 10:00am on Friday, May 23rd.  
New York Focus is New York's only statewide nonprofit newsroom, covering how power works in the Empire State and giving citizens the tools they need to participate in their democracy. Launched in 2020, we fill a glaring gap: almost half of New York’s newspapers have died in the last two decades. The crisis has been especially acute in Albany, which scores at the top of national corruption rankings, wields a larger budget than 90 percent of the world’s countries, and regularly overrides local policy, yet receives a fragment of scrutiny. After starting on a shoestring budget and mostly volunteer basis, New York Focus has grown to a full-time team of 15, with reporters covering issues like climate, criminal justice, and social services, our journalism spurring lawsuits, legislative changes, and policy implementation. 

Sam Mellins is senior reporter at New York Focus, which he has been a part of since launch day. His reporting has also appeared in The San Francisco Chronicle, The Intercept, THE CITY, and The Nation. Reach him on Signal: mellins.613      

Rebecca Klein serves as New York Focus’s Publisher. Before joining the organization in 2021, she covered national education issues as a senior reporter and editor at HuffPost. Her work has also appeared in outlets including NPR, The Guardian, and The Hechinger Report.  She was previously the Center for Community Media fellow at the CUNY Newmark Executive Program in News Innovation and Leadership.** 

Write postcards with us or just join the conversation. If you need help getting started with postcarding, please visit our [FAQ](https://markersfordemocracy.org/postcarding/postcarding-faq).

If you are with the media and want to attend, you must notify us at markersfordemocracy@gmail.com at least two hours before the start of the event. All discussions are off the record.

This event is co-hosted by [Markers For Democracy](https://markersfordemocracy.org), [Downtown Nasty Women Social Group](https://linktr.ee/DNWSG), and [Team Min](https://linktr.ee/teammin
).

description:
On June 14—Flag Day—Donald Trump wants tanks in the street and a made-for-TV display of dominance for his birthday. A spectacle meant to look like strength. But real power isn’t staged in Washington. It rises up everywhere else.
No Kings is a nationwide day of defiance. From city blocks to small towns, from courthouse steps to community parks, we’re taking action to reject authoritarianism—and show the world what democracy really looks like.
We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.
The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.
On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings.

title: Distribute Know Your Rights info to Amtrak and Greyhound passengers
description:
On April 13, 2025, US Border Patrol (USBP) agents boarded an Amtrak train at the Havre, MT station and systematically went up and down the train asking each passenger for their papers. Agents also questioned passengers who were on the platform stretching their legs during the train stop. 
  (https://www.havredailynews.com/story/2025/04/17/local/ice-questions-amtrak-passengers-in-havre-about-citizenship/547792.html) 

While no arrests were made that day by USBP or ICE officers during the incident, this was clearly an attempt to intimidate train passengers. We suppose that the purpose also was to establish a protocol for use by ICE or BP officers in other locations. 

Interstate transit passengers, regardless of their immigration or citizenship status, are entitled to the same Constitutional rights of liberty and due process, and against self-incrimination, unreasonable search and seizure.

In this action, we will distribute Transit Passenger Know Your Rights information to people at the Reno Amtrak station, which also serves as the Reno stop for Greyhound buses. The materials will be in English and Spanish; we are working on translations in Chinese and Tagalog.

We will start by distributing the booklet to westbound passengers, because the "100 mile zone" in which Customs and Border Protection has jurisdiction includes almost all of the train/bus route between Reno and San Francisco.. Choose among Friday times or Saturday times. 

"Know Your Rights"  fliers will be distributed either:
1)  in front of the train station, for actual trains, or
2)  at the bus stop across the street. Look for the Bus Stop sign. This is the boarding location for Amtrak buses and Greyhound/Flix buses. 

Join us in informing people of their Constitutional rights!

title: VIRTUAL: "Christian Nationalism and the Threat to American Democracy" ft. Amanda Tyler

sponsor.name: Americans United for Separation of Church and State

description:
The Rochester, NY chapter of Americans United presents

## Christian Nationalism and the Threat to American Democracy

Executive director of BJC and lead organizer of Christians Against Christian Nationalism, Amanda Tyler will discuss the threats that Christian nationalism, a political ideology, poses to democracy, pluralism, and public life in the U.S. Tyler will call for an end to Christian nationalism in order to defend the separation of church and state as well as faith freedom for all.

### About our guest speaker:

Amanda Tyler is executive director of BJC (Baptist Joint Committee for Religious Liberty), leading the organization as it upholds the historic Baptist principle of religious liberty: defending the free exercise of religion and protecting against its establishment by government. The author of _How to End Christian Nationalism_ (October 2024), Tyler is also the co-host of BJC’s Respecting Religion podcast. Tyler’s constitutional law analysis and advocacy for faith freedom for all have been featured by major news outlets, including The New York Times, The Washington Post, CBS News, ABC News, CNN, and MSNBC, and she has testified before Congress on religious liberty and Christian nationalism. A graduate of Georgetown University and The University of Texas School of Law, she lives in Dallas with her husband and son.

Co-sponsored by:  

* Atlantic Coast, FL Chapter of Americans United  
* Greater Naples, FL Chapter of Americans United  
* Houston, TX Chapter of Americans United
* Massachusetts Chapter of Americans United

title: Mothers and Others Standing Against Fascism - All ages welcome!
description:
NOT ON OUR WATCH!

In honor of Mother's Day weekend, and as part of actions happening throughout the state of Ohio, we invite mothers and others to join this inspirational rally in standing up and speaking out against fascism.

On Saturday, May 10, concerned citizens will gather in communities across Ohio to say no to the bullies and billionaires who are threatening our freedoms, stealing our children's future and disappearing neighbors from our streets. Join us and make your voice heard!

Also, come hear premier Cleveland musicians performing as **Musicians Against Dictators (MAD)**!

Come dressed in whatever makes you happy (maybe bright colors, rainbows, costumes). We are choosing to focus on JOY in these chaotic times!

There will be a **collection of hygiene products** for area families in need- so bring deodorant, soap, shampoo, toothpaste, diapers/wipes, etc. if you can!

**All ages welcome! Rain or shine!**

Hosted by Mobilize the Vote NEO, Cuyahoga Democratic Women's Caucus, GRR (Grass Roots Resistance); GRAB (Grass Roots Activism Bay), Indivisible NEO, Americans Making Immigrants Safe (AMIS)

title: Step Up CD-8: Anthem Protest (Anthem Way & Gavilan Peak Pkwy)

address_lines: West Anthem Way & North Gavilan Peak Parkway

description:
### About this event 

📍 **Location:** Anthem Way & Gavilan Peak Pkwy  
🗓 **Date:** Saturday, May 10, 2025  
⏰ **Time:** 8:00 AM – 9:30 AM  

(Looking for a different Step Up location? Go to linktr.ee/stepupcd8.)

We’re standing up to **Donald Trump** because **Rep. Abe Hamadeh won’t**!

Join your neighbors for a peaceful, high-visibility protest as part of the **Step Up CD-8 multi-site protest.**

While Trump and his billionaire friends dismantle our government for their own personal gain, CD-8 Congressman **Abe Hamadeh has been hiding from constituents** behind closed-door events with donors and MAGA voters.

For months, concerned constituents across CD-8 have asked Rep. Abe Hamadeh to hold a public town hall and listen to the concerns of the people he was elected to represent. Instead, we’ve been met with silence — and even **threats of arrest**.

When we demonstrated peacefully outside his office, his staff **had a senior adult woman’s car towed**. When our numbers grew, Hamadeh coordinated with GOP counter-protestors to **obstruct our access to a public sidewalk**.

**It’s clear: Hamadeh answers to Trump, not to us**.

So on **May 10**, we’re taking the message to five cities across CD-8:
**Enough**.

### We'll be at the following locations:

- Lake Pleasant Pkwy & Happy Valley Rd in **Peoria**

---
### Here’s what we need you to do:

This coordinated effort is powered by a coalition of grassroots groups:

title: MAY DAY: WOODSTOCK WORKERS RISING
description:
📣 EVENT UPDATE – PLEASE READ

Due to the forecast of severe thunderstorms on Saturday, we are rescheduling the “May Day: Woodstock Workers Rising” protest to **Saturday, May 10**.

🕓 Same time
📍 Same location
🛟 Same safety protocols and logistics—unless otherwise noted
☀️ The weather for May 10 is expected to be clear and rain-free.

***BUT—we’re still gathering this weekend.***

Instead of protesting in the storm, we’re inviting everyone to join us indoors at the ***Artists’ Spring Art Showcase at the Artisan Resource Center in Marietta***. It’s a huge, open, community-driven space filled with local art, open studios, and a handmade artisan market—just in time for Mother’s Day.

🎨 Saturday, May 3 — ***10am to 6pm***
📍 585  Cobb  Parkway  South, Marietta, GA 30060
🎟️ Free & open to the public
🔗 http://www.artisanresourcecenter.net/events.html

Why this matters:
Fascism always targets art. Creators challenge power, build culture, and make resistance visible. Showing up for artists is showing up for freedom. In an era of censorship, tariffs, and corporate monopolies, our local artists need solidarity—and you just might find better deals than at a big box store.

Thanks for staying grounded, flexible, and focused on what we’re building together.

***See you this weekend—and next.***
—Indivisible Woodstock CAN


🛠 DRESS THE PART. BRING A SIGN. STAND WITH WORKERS.

This May Day, we stand together as the people who keep this town running—workers who teach our kids, care for the sick, grow our food, build our homes, and serve our neighbors.

No matter your job or background, we all deserve a fair shot: fair pay, personal freedom, safe communities, and leaders who work for us, not just for billionaires and backroom lobbyists.

Too many of those freedoms are being chipped away—by people in power who treat workers like a cost to cut, not a voice to listen to.

We say no more.

👕 Dress up as a worker—your job, or one you admire. 🪧 Make a sign that shows what that worker deserves—and what’s at risk.

👨‍👩‍👧 This is a peaceful, family-friendly protest. ✊Wear red, white, and blue to show we are the real patriots. 🚫 No profanity on signs—our message is strong without it.

🛠 WHAT IS MAY DAY?

May Day—International Workers’ Day—honors the people who built this country.

It began with American workers striking in 1886 for the eight-hour workday. When police opened fire on protesters at Chicago’s Haymarket Square, it became a global symbol of the fight for dignity on the job.

Governments around the world now recognize May 1st as a day to stand with labor. But in the U.S., we’ve been told to forget.

We remember. May Day belongs to us. And we’re reclaiming it.

🧍🏽‍♀️ EXAMPLES: LOCAL WORKERS, LOCAL POWER

🛒 Retail Worker (Publix, Target, Home Depot) with a sign that says, “We stock your shelves. Don’t empty our paychecks.”

👩🏽‍⚕️ Healthcare Worker (Nurse, Tech, Aide) with a sign that says, “We care for your family. Let us care for ours.”

📚 Teacher or School Staff with a sign that says, “Let us teach. Keep politics out of the classroom.”

🍽 Restaurant or Food Service Worker with a sign that says, “We served through the storm. We deserve better.”

💼 Office Worker / Business Services with a sign that says, “We’re not overhead. We’re the engine.”

👷 Construction Worker with a sign that says, “We build Woodstock. Give us a future here.”

⚙️ Manufacturing or Warehouse Worker with a sign that says, “We move the goods. Respect the hands behind the supply chain.”

✊ WHAT TO EXPECT:

We’ll line up peacefully along the sidewalk in downtown Woodstock with signs and costumes

This is a legal, unpermitted protest: we will obey all laws and exercise our First Amendment rights without blocking traffic or pedestrians

🔧 HOW TO JOIN:

Pick your worker costume
Make your sign (no profanity)
Wear red, white, and blue
📍 Meeting location will be announced soon.

RSVP & follow for updates:

Instagram: @indivisiblewoodstockcan

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61573799888446

Bluesky: https://bsky.app/profile/woodstockcan.bsky.social

May Day isn’t a memory. It’s a movement. This is our moment to show who really makes this town strong. Not Wall Street. Not the lobbyists. The workers. The people. Us.
